{{doomwiki}} {{Gzdoomfeature}} The '''DEHEXTRA''' standard, also known as ''DeHackEd Extended'' or ''DeHackEd Extra'', is a extension standard for [[DeHackEd]] patches first introduced in the Doom Retro source port. It provides a significant increase in the number of [[thing]]s and [[sprite]]s that can be utilized, in addition to the inclusion of 2,910 new states or codepointers. These can be utilized for new map object types, new non-replacing [[monster]]s and decorations, or to add additional frames to existing things for smoother animations. The additional objects are called {{c|MT_EXTRA}} in Doom Retro.
GZDoom provides support for the standard. The WhackEd editor provides support for DEHEXTRA features through the Doom Retro configuration parameter.
==Features== * 2,910 additional states/codepointers (numbered 1,089 to 3,999) * 100 additional things (numbered 150 to 249) * 100 additional sprites (numbered 145 to 244)
The following additional entries are supported in {{c|THING}} blocks: {| {{prettytable}} ! Entry || Description |- | Gib health || - |- | Dropped item || - |- | Pickup width || - |- | Project pass height || - |- | Fullbright || - |}
==Examples== DEHEXTRA has been utilized in the following mods: * Black Ops: Smooth animated weapons using the new additional states for improved animation, with Doomguy wearing black gloves. * SMOOTHED: Smooth animated beastiary utilizing code from the Smooth Doom project.
Both mods can be used together to provide a more streamlined Doom experience in terms of animation.
==Trivia== * Unlike [[DECORATE]] or [[ZScript]], DEHEXTRA is not to be considered a [[lump]], as it should be thought of as more of an ''extension'' to DeHackEd.
